title: Frontend hard reset: mount user-provided V1.0 App.jsx via editable entry points and remove legacy feature UI

requirements.summary: Reset the frontend UI by wiring the user-provided V1.0 src/App.jsx as the new root UI without modifying immutable files.
acceptanceCriteria: The root rendered UI matches the user-provided `src/App.jsx` behavior and structure as the new V1.0 baseline (not the prior multi-page app).

No edits are made to files under `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, or `frontend/src/components/ui` (immutable paths); if the new app must be mounted, it is done via editable files (e.g., `frontend/src/App.tsx` and/or new files) without modifying immutable paths.
The frontend builds successfully with the current toolchain (React + TypeScript + Tailwind).

file_operations.description: Add the user-provided V1.0 `src/App.jsx` code as-is in this file (exact replacement baseline for the reset).

Replace the current root component implementation so it only mounts/exports the V1.0 UI from `frontend/src/AppV1.jsx`, ensuring no imports/usages of legacy auth/routing/data-layer flows remain here (and without changing `frontend/src/main.tsx`).

requirements.summary: Hard cutover: remove/disable previously implemented advanced frontend features and references not present in the user-provided V1.0 files.
acceptanceCriteria: The app no longer references previous feature modules/components/hooks/routes that are not part of the user-provided V1.0 files.
The repository compiles and runs end-to-end (frontend + backend) after the reset without relying on any of the previously built feature code.

file_operations.description: Remove legacy Internet Identity login page implementation so it cannot be referenced by the new V1.0 root UI.
Remove legacy client dashboard page (tabs, browsing, VIP/dashboard logic) as part of the hard reset.
Remove legacy pro dashboard page (monopoly mode, revenue chart, creator flows) as part of the hard reset.
Remove legacy salon details/booking flow UI to ensure no bookings/availability/monopoly logic remains after the reset.
Remove legacy authenticated header UI so the reset does not retain logout/badge/notification logic.
Remove legacy profile-setup modal to disable prior profile onboarding flow.
Remove legacy loyalty/VIP dashboard UI and visuals.
Remove legacy loyalty tier/XP card component to eliminate VIP/XP display logic.
Remove legacy salon browsing list implementation (categories, featured salon, image loading) as part of the reset.
Remove legacy multi-step salon creation wizard to disable seeded premium salons and publishing flows.
Remove legacy studio/salon creator flow to disable salon creation management UI.
Remove legacy monopoly-mode toggle UI to ensure the reset no longer exposes that feature.
Remove legacy revenue chart UI to eliminate pro analytics visuals from the reset baseline.
Remove legacy React Query-based data layer hooks so the reset does not rely on the prior caching/query architecture.
Remove legacy salon image fetching/conversion hook to eliminate prior on-chain image retrieval logic from the UI.
Remove legacy currency formatting utilities that were specific to the previous multi-feature UI.
Remove legacy URL parameter utilities that supported prior admin/feature flows.
